awd_titl_txt: Improving the Computer Integrated Manufacturing (CIM)       Curriculum Through the Acquisition of a DNC System
awd_abstract_narration: The acquisition of a Distributed Numerical Control (DNC) System                 at Camden County College enables students to fully integrate                    Computer Aided Design (CAD) to Computer Aided Manufacturing                     (CAM) to the Computer Numerical Control (CNC) machining.  This                  acquisition allows data to move automatically onto the factory                  floor, truly integrating computers in manufacturing.  The broad                 goals of career education, education for life and employment,                   form the core of the Computer Integrated Manufacturing (CIM)                    curriculum.  The CIM curriculum provides students at the                        community college with the education and skills to respond to                   the present and future needs of business and industry, and the                  addition of the DNC system to the CIM laboratory creates a                      fully integrated industrial environment for the program.
